newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Metals shrs limit down on LME rumours.
newsitem.headline: LG Metals shrs limit down on LME rumours.

text.p: Shares of LG Metals Corp fell limit-down in early Thursday trading on rumours it faced trouble due to short positions on the London Metal Exchange, brokers said.
LG Metals dropped 1,200 won to 13,800, its daily limit-low, before recovering to 14,700.
The company has denied it is in trouble on the LME.

Hong Seong-ho, the company's team manager for aluminium and LME sales, said on Wednesday its copper shorts were a stocks carryover hedge and that the firm had not requested increased LME credit lines or received margin calls from its brokers.

Traders in London have said the copper market was very tight, with nearby supply scarce and the premium over futures prices -- that must be paid for prompt delivery -- soaring. Big speculative shorts are having to pay high premiums to cover maturing positions which run up to mid-February.
